result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. RYAN S BAUER

records.addlTxt:
11:02 AM Defendant RYAN S BAUER in court.  Attorney Christopher Wilhelm in court for RYAN S BAUER.  Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Wilhelm requests to schedule a plea hearing outside of intake. To be schedule with the JA.

11:23 AM Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant RYAN S BAUER in court.  Attorney Christopher Wilhelm in court for RYAN S BAUER. 
Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

BOND COVERS 21CF680 (amended), 22CF378, 22CF379 & 22CF380
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia / syringes unless medically required.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages / illegal drugs / any prescription drugs not prescribed.
Defendant shall not go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Defendant shall not drive with any alcohol in system.
Daily PBTs at CHSO; or enroll and actively participate in IDIP; or Soberlink device.
Bond in 21CF680 applied to new files.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing
